column4: hey does anyone know how to change the defaults for certain UNIX programs
like Shred
man shred
why would becoming a good C++ developer necessitate OpenBSD?
it doesn't it's good example code to learn secure coding
perhaps kernel level, but a lot of software comes to them from third parties and they patch that
even Ubuntu code, but if you're interested in secure coding
yeah so its still good example code and its very well documented
define Ubuntu code, there's Linux if you mean kernel level
also Ubuntu code, but it's not as mature in security as OpenBSD
define Ubuntu code
you do realize the difference between userland and kernel right?
yeah
then what's "Ubuntu" code?
the code that Ubuntu has built up from the Debian base
the code that the developers are actively working on
as in the package manager? because Ubuntu is not GNOME for example
I know
what do you think ubuntu codes
developers*
Ubuntu developers maintain packages for the most part
I thought they are expanding and changing a lot of the Debian code
still, if you mean to say kernel, say Linux and not Ubuntu
true sorry about that
